page.title: 02SMALLWORTH.
page.content: Smallworth is primarily one street of private {HOUSING}leading eastwards from the B1111, forking right to Blo- Norton and left to the A1066. Initially it consisted of scattered farmhouses and labourers cottages with a school, public house and chapel. Building infill has resulted in an harmonious mix of new and old but the school, the pub and the chapel have gone and the area has been integrated into and forms part of the Parish of {GARBOLDISHAM.}Farmland still abuts private boundaries. Near the road fork is{HARBOUR}lane. Some think that a waterway once led from the LITTLE OUSE to the lane to give it its name but no signs remain. In Blo'Norton Rd. the parish{BOUNDARY}line results in facing dwellings being sited in adjacent parishes, Blo-Norton residents being far from their village centre.
